meanings.definition: A small bag or pouch, typically made of leather, used to carry money or other small items.
meanings.sent1: I keep my coins in a tiny burse.
meanings.sent2: She reached into her burse to pay for the candy.
meanings.sent3: The burse was so full of coins, it looked like a treasure chest!
meanings.sent4: Her burse was a magic bag, always producing the exact change needed.
meanings.sent5: The burse jingled with the sound of coins as she walked.

meanings.definition: To manage or handle money or financial matters.
meanings.sent1: He learned to burse his allowance wisely.
meanings.sent2: She burses the family budget with care.
meanings.sent3: I tried to burse my piggy bank, but it wouldn't open!
meanings.sent4: She bursed her way through the financial maze of life.
meanings.sent5: Bursing requires attention to every penny.
